5.28.25  5:29 pm   lots of musicians, especially in the gospel world clown people for transposing. i can play in all keys, major/minor with the exceptions of F, G, A, and D. (they suck so bad holy crap). would transposing be better as a safer option in terms of gigs or should i just not take gigs to practice (and ultimately fail at playing) the keys?

(i ask you this cause you're an awesome musician)

thanks, D.

Â Â Â Â Â  how about just taking the gigs and try not to transpose. best way to learn. or you can transpose, it doesn't really matter. but feel free to challenge yourself, just certainly don't skip gigs because of it. if you want to learn to do something, gigs are really the best way to do that anyway

5.27.25  8:14 pm   I have a lot of ideas for projects/things I can work on, do you have any advice about keeping yourself focused enough to make progress on a few at a time without getting distracted or overwhelmed by the possibilities?

Â Â Â Â Â  basically what may happen as this: you struggle to figure it out, you still can't figure it out. you struggle to figure it out, you still can't figure it out. you want desperately to figure it out, your desire to figure it out increases, you still can't figure it out. it goes on and on like this, until eventually, you start to actually realize 'i may never get it. i may never figure this out. ive been trying so long and it still hasnt worked, i actually am starting to think it might never work.' But as you sink lower into desperation, simpler possibilities become more and more exciting. So ultimately if you sink down low enough, heck even just the idea of doing each project one at a time in alphabetical order, that suddenly seems incredibly exciting because in a world where you were scared that there are no possibilities, there now actually is one

5.27.25  6:17 am   In perfect the characters mention several times they are going to go somewhere else but they never do. Was there originally a plan to have the characters go somewhere else or was it always the intention to have the characters remain in one place?

Â Â Â Â Â  writers often talk about the advantages and disadvantages of 'outlining' or planning out your plot before you write. the more i consider this issue, the more and more eagerly i throw myself onto the no-outline bandwagon. That means at each moment when i'm writing the story, i have just as no idea what's going to happen next as you the first-time viewer. i could rave through the ceiling trying to explain all the advantages i find in doing it this way. most importantly it ensurees that the writer and viewer are always in the same space. but anyway, this video in particular is a celebration of the no-outline method, so it's plan-free. are they going somewhere? they certainly can, the option is always open, so that's probably why the possibility comes up from time to time. you can be sure that any time someone asks if they are going somewhere, i the writer did not know the answer yet at that time

5.27.25  4:34 am   For the I'm a Princess music video, does the Cone on top of the stack of 3D shapes from the start (and end) refer to both Princess Party hats and Dunce hats, and is that the reason for the ending of "I'm a Dunce?"

Â Â Â Â Â  the song audio was completed before the video was started, so there's no chance that the video influenced the audio. however, it's possible that the audio influenced the choices made in the video. Looking at the first scene, the important thing to remember about this scene is that i was basically a total beginniner in the 3D environment i was using at the time. so i probably had no idea if it was going to work. but then i put some lights in, then i was hooked
